fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Economy, finance and the euro, Trade, Competition, Customs, Employment and Social Affairs, Business and Industry, Taxation
head_office_address: European Union Business Forum in Ethiopia Arada Sub-City, Woreda 07, House n°467
eu_initiatives:
To provide a platform for European businesses in Ethiopia. 
To provide access to local market knowledge for stakeholders in Europe. 
To advocate for a better business environment in Ethiopia. 
To facilitate the dialogue between the European private sector and the Ethiopian government. 
To develop and enhance EU position and image in Ethiopia.
organisation_name: European Union Business Forum in Ethiopia (EUBFE)
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
membership: European Business Organisation Worldwide Network (EBOWWN) - www.ebowwn.com
goals__remit: The EU Business Forum in Ethiopia aims to facilitate operations for EU companies doing business in Ethiopia through (i) Improving the exchange of information about the Ethiopian business and regulatory environment; (ii) Developing a platform for networking and forging business links between EU companies; and (iii) Facilitating dialogue with the various Ethiopian authorities.
relevant_communication:
1) Dialogue and Advocacy:  
 
Technical Committee: The Technical Committee, with representation from relevant Ministries and Agencies of the Ethiopian Government, the EU Delegation, EU member states (Germany, France, Italy, Netherlands and UK) and the EUBFE establishes a dedicated forum for technical discussions on agreed upon issues. The goal of the Technical Committee is to identify and discuss regulations and other current procedures that create unnecessary constraints for investors, while formulating practical actions to address them.  
 
Cooperation with the Ethiopian Revenue & Customs Authority (ERCA): The EUBFE signed a MoU with ERCA in May 2012 in order to facilitate information-sharing and to provide a channel for the EU business community to express its remarks and questions.  
 
 
2)Networking: 
  
The EUBFE has organised several networking events in order for the EU business community to be able to meet and share their respective experiences. 
The EUBFE has also organised thematic cocktails, where a guest speaker discussed about a specific current issue. 
 
3) Communication: 
 
The EUBFE has been issuing quarterly newsletters to inform the EU business communities on recent news and events. The EUBFE also set up a website (eubfe.eu), where useful information about Ethiopia, the EUBFE and on doing business in Ethiopia can be found.
